description: Fletcher +â€Ž -ize, after Horace Fletcher, who advocated the practice.

verbs.description: fletcherize (third-person singular simple present fletcherizes, present participle fletcherizing, simple past and past participle fletcherized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To thoroughly chew (dozens or hundreds of times) before swallowing.
(figurative, by extension) To consume, to devour, to bite, to chew over.
